column4: How does one downgrade a specific app to a specific vers? Wine for instance..?
in the past ive also removed wine. then downloaded/installed the specicic version i needed
Thx! In an other dist I used that was "frowned upon" so I thought I had better ask first...still new to ubuntu :)
wine is very much a 'hammer it till it works with your app you need to run' sort of thing
It would seem that the "pinning" option is the opposite to what I need. I am on 10.04 and the wine vers installed is: wine-1.1.42 but I need to downgrade to at least 1.1.5...
So, since pinning is sort of opposite what I need, how would one dg wine to 1.1.5?
What the settings should be in dancer-services/settings.conf?
I would check the dancer homepage/wiki/docs   if the utulity has rather poor docs. it may be worth while to use an alterantive that is better documented.,
I've been googling my butt off with no success..
The program dosent even mention a 'homepage' when you google about it? Definatly time to find another program then.
many of those things often are based on another  that might have more docs..
Right. But which...THAT is the true question eh?
This: dancer-ircd-doc was installed but I have NO idea how to use it... o.O
you looked in /usr/share/docs ? or was it /usr/share/doc ?
I just saw the pkg as installed. So far...looking...
